Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Market Oysters 1.0
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu Beef Tartare 1.1

aWNOBonJOP9NkQnDtKkkRQ.text: Delicious food. Our waiter was awesome. Beautiful atmosphere. Appreciated the wine pairing suggestions. Great experience.

FUg5gi8CPS1uWCzauE7Tlg.text: If you want your tastebuds to party in Vegas, come here. The food and service is beyond amazing.

wppq9es7mFpfKA1eMTOQGg.text: If Las Vegas has one unfair advantage over Los Angeles, it's the inclusion of foie gras on their menus. Ever since it was banned in CA, we've had to cross over to NV to get our foie fix, and Sage was an excellent choice for doing so. My wife and I decided to divide and conquer Chef McClain's Signature tasting menu for $89. Without going through every dish, I'll say these were the standouts; the Foie Gras Brulee (easily worth the $10 supplement and bordering on heavenly), Wagyu Beef Tartare, Grilled Spanish Octopus, Australian Wagyu Sirloin (an additional $15, but again, comes with foie) and for dessert, the Sweet Potato Pie with Angostura Bitters ice cream (someone needs to mass produce this ASAP, as it is awesome). Our server was excellent and I'd definitely consider returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amuse-bouche
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Potato Pie with Angostura Bitters Ice Cream.

YWxNbm5c6KcKG2J_1N4d_A.text: I don't know where to begin with this review. Everything was beyond amazing. The food was incredible, ambiance was awesome and our server Lauren was absolutely the best. Her recommendations were on point and I really enjoyed watching her light my absinthe on fire from the cart. If I could give this restaurant more than 5 stars I absolutely would. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a high class dinner on the strip. 5/5 would return again. Thank you Lauren for all your great recommendations and excellent service.

IT80cGC2mP5CgQRs0Xjcyg.text: After a less-than-stellar week, we really were looking forward to our weekend in Vegas, and since we were alone in Vegas on Friday night, I looked for a place that had an interesting tasting menu to go try. I'm really glad I found Sage.  We had a 7:15 reservation, and it wasn't really very busy when we were there, but it could have been that Vegas itself isn't insanely busy the weekend after New Year, as lots of other restaurants didn't seem that busy over the weekend either. But that didn't matter, because we had stellar service the whole night.  So we went for the eight-course tasting menu with wine pairings. They gave us an oyster as an amuse bouche, and it was absolutely delicious so we knew we were in for a great menu. They offer two types of bread: sourdough and a bacon roll. We tried both, but just moved on to the bacon roll when they returned because they were insanely good.  Of the courses, I think the first course of crab and yellowtail was probably the best one, but the next course of citrus poached foie gras was brilliant. Just the right amount of citrus. The wine pairings were pretty stellar as well. Desserts were top notch as well, and even though they opera cake dessert didn't at all resemble an opera cake (which was a shame to be honest, I get the concept of deconstruction, but there's more showmanship in an assembled opera cake that I was looking forward to), it was incredibly rich and awesome.  We also opted for the absinthe cart which was a treat. I've never seen it made, and it was a nice show. For me though, even though absinthe is traditionally one part absinthe to four parts water, I would have preferred a bit less water to give the flavor profile more of a punch. But I enjoyed it completely.  The only dip in service for the whole night was when the rabbit dish arrived and we had no wine, but they made up for it by giving us quite a bit extra of that wine given there was sediment and the wine arrived late. So, they made up for that completely.  Sage is amazing. If you want top-notch fine dining in Vegas come here. And enjoy yourself. Get the tasting menu.

2HTh2A-fBHEdcsVtHbnwhw.text: Great wait staff and also hostess up front.  We all went with the two course which includes a starter and an entree.    Starters: Wagyu Beef Tartare: I was not a fan of this starter.  It's raw, similar to tuna tartare, but the smell and texture didn't make me stomach it too well.  I took a bite to taste and that's it.  Caution - not only is the Wagyu raw but there is a poached egg on top as well.  It seems this was a popular selection for many Yelpers, however I can vouch it was the least picked on dish at the table.    Roasted Veal Sweetbreads: This was a richer appetizer.  It was a perfect combination between "filling/meaty" and creamy.  I wouldn't order this dish again however.     Foie Gras Custard Brulee:  Wow.  If you enjoy foie gras and also enjoy creme brulee then try this!   I'd be lying if I said I wouldn't come back just to try this again. ;-) It's the perfect mix between sweet and salty. I would staple this as a must try at Sage.  Alaskan King Crab:  Light dish, cooked perfectly, flavors compliment each other, and if you're ordering a heavy and rich entree I would recommend this as a starter.  Entrees: Black Bass: Delicious!  Very filling and light dish.  Main Day Boat Scallops: I've ordered this before - and I'm ordering it again.  Trumpet mushrooms, oxtail, and a perfectly cooked scallop.  I can't ask for anything more.    I would definitely recommend Sage for tourist staying at the Aria.  Out of every other restaurant I've tried, this one is the most memorable.

1gus5NA1Ke33D4TzdCyqqA.text: This is a great place.  The restaurant is tucked away in the Aria resort and it's really attractive inside.  The ceilings are super high but with the chandeliers, artwork and different eating spaces, it really feels like a much smaller space.  The menu is a bit confusing.  There's an ala carte menu, a 4 course fixed price menu with choices, and an 8 course tasting menu (no choices).  We opted to order from the ala carte menu.  For my appetizer, I had the grilled Spanish octopus.  This was well made but not spectacular.  The octopus was tender but I prefer more char on it - mine was so devoid of char that I couldn't tell if it was grilled or not.  My entree was the 36 hour wagyu short rib.  This is cooked for 36 hours in a sous vide machine.  Delicious!  There's a large dessert menu and, of all things, an Absinthe menu!  Didn't think of it at the time, but I should have tried one of those... how often do you really get the chance  to try that?

WCCW9TXV1gQCB14Vab0FAw.text: After reading reviews I booked a table for myself and seven friends for my 30th birthday.  The setting was great and the tasting menu on paper seemed too good to be True.  Unfortunately it was. The food was good but not great. The service was less than great.  For $200 a person with an auto gratuity we sat waiting at our table for 10-15min before the waitstaff stopped to ask what kind of water we wanted.  The tasting menu was not provided and we had to request it.  At the end we wanted to split the bill which was no issue but the waiter motioned to his watch and referenced timing when we asked that he run two credit cards and take the balance in cash.   Not a great experience to say the least.    The highlight for me was the scallops and desert.  Maybe we had a bad waiter and I ordered the wrong items at each course...regardless I left feeling full yet unsatisfied with the experience.

hfFdQInnlYDkhY1szfc6KQ.text: Simply, WOW!!!   Had reservations for a Monday night, place was fairly empty, so we were seated immediately.  Waitstaff was knowledgable and attentive... Our table ordered from the dinner menu, decided against the tasting menu, but will probably give it a shot on our next trip... Our entrees were, the scallops, the duck, and the pork. After trying a little of everyone's dishes, we were all very satisfied with our personal selections, but couldn't wait to return to devour one of the other selections!! Finished the night off with absinthe... When in Rome... First time tasting, very pleased and will be sampling different types in the future...   Will I be returning? We ate at sage on day one of our trip, I tried finding a way to go back before we left town.. Cannot wait to return!!

9Cw7Gj9dGgJkXA_PoyT2XA.text: I was so tired upon completion of my late afternoon business meeting in Vegas that I was thrilled to have Yelp tell me that a 4.5 star restaurant was located off the lobby of my Vegas Strip hotel.  Sage was one of those magnificent, beginning to end experiences that allows heaping praise without hesitation, as so much going right cannot be coincidence.  I had an incredible first course of warm wild mushroom sald with pine nuts and black currants, washed down with a glass of sparkling Rose'.   I went high dollar for the entree--a few notches above most of the others in price at $43 and got the black cod, smoked grapes, pumpkin flan, a crisp of prosciutto and a few layers of Brussels sprouts.  I'm not kidding.  It was magnificent.  I savored every bite.  I was so pleased I did not want to spoil my palate with any sweetness or cappuccino.  I just wanted to savor the perfection on a plate I had just experienced in two short courses.  I was alone in town for work so I sat at the bar myself and had metronomic attention and delivery.  The skillful bartender knew, among the patrons eating at the bar, who to engage with and who to mindfully check on but let alone.  He was wonderful.  This was a topflight experience and if it is any indication of an average night, I unequivocally recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black cod with pumpkin flan and smoked grapes. Incredible. $43.
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushroom salad with pine nuts and black currants. Awesome.

veIXsMtN9om2XrUvl6TBGg.text: Let's face it, if you are going to Sage you know you plan on spending a decent amount of $, it shouldn't be a "shock" when your bill is over $100.  That being said, on our trip to Vegas in May for our first anniversary we decided to make a reservation at Sage for our anniversary dinner.  We were so glad we did as everything we ate was nothing short of stellar.  To start my meal i ordered the Confit Heirloom Beet salad.  The toasted dates and vinaigrette dressing complemented the beets so perfectly.  Every bite was full of flavors and different textures, delicious. I ate every bite.  I was expecting the portion to be much smaller than it actually was, so I was pleasantly surprised when it arrived.  The complimentary amuse bouche was the best bite I have ever had.  I couldn't even tell you what it was, but it was delicious and I wanted more.  I ordered the Lobster Ravioli for dinner.  What a refreshing dish.  Not your typical ravioli dish filled with heavy cream making you feel like you have a rock in your stomach.  This was light with hints of lemon and sweet chunks of Maine Lobster. I ate every last bite.  Service was top notch, our waiter was one of the best I have ever had.  Attentive and spot on with his suggestions.  We will be back for sure

UDjggWt_6jeZuYQeyyfQCw.text: Conflicted on my review because this restaurant is really good but it is shockingly expensive. Like a trip to Mastro's expensive and the food isn't on that level. They are also rocking a 3 to 4 times mark up on wine.  The service and ambience are pretty great though, so check it out, but bring your high limit credit card for sure.

nnuCzWtLB2EulOxzsdcQFg.text: This place is good, but definitely only someplace I would visit when friends are in town.   We ate all the stuff that foodies would order.  Foie Gras-Good Braised Beef Tongue-Really good Wagyu Beef Tartare-Amazing Grilled Octopus-Really good Sweetbreads-Mhm different in a good way  Braised Veal Cheeks-Good Scallops-just like anywhere else  Absinthe Blend-Nasty and I love to drink  The place is affordable for the quality and the location...there you have it.

-YxCnN5clk9eFVHG6mLQ6A.text: I've been to Sage several times already, and I'm never disappointed. I love the ambience and privacy of this place. It's not loud or obnoxious at all. I've probably had everything on their menu, and their foie gras creme brulee is the best. I've had foie gras a million ways, and this is definitely the best preparation I've had. Their slow poached farm egg with the black truffle is also amazing. So creamy and delicious. Their filet and skirt steak are a must have. I don't remember the name, but their cotton candy cocktail is delicious and sweet. The service is always great and professional. Safe to say I love everything about this place. And yes, I WILL be back.

f9wY3zMVhx8RasSQhkxFIA.text: Do any of you have one of those single friends that flies private jets...needs a little bit of social tutoring, calls and asks what you are doing for dinner...says to fly out to Los Angeles...wipes his ass with 100 dolla bills....but is a nice guy?   Well I don't have any friends like that.  Just needed a nice intro to this review.    Keep in mind my pinky finger is elevated as I'm typing.  Yes I'm a wino.    00 Krug Rose 99 Les Demoiselles 86 Cote Rotie Lala.   Get the egg.  Get the egg.  Get the egg.  We did the prefixe menu...get the egg.  I don't remember stuff afterwards.  Just get the egg app.    Congrats to Nicky for being the only person to pass the MS this year.  Hugs.

_Qk6K-gGfTevaOR5vJVOfA.text: I've tried several high-end dining choices The Strip offers, but I always come back to Sage whenever I want amazing food (and when my wallet can handle it). I've always gone for the Signature Menu (~$89) with four courses.   Food: Amazing. Portion sizes are just enough to make you happy full, not Olive Garden full. Every bite has a plethora of different textures and tastes that complement each other -- I felt like I was commentating the Food Channel when I ate here with the bf. And not only that, it was different -- the tastes, and textures were completely things you have yet to try. Party in my mouth, indeed. From the complimentary plates (comes with every meal) to the bread to the dessert, I cannot rave enough about this place.   Service: Excellent. Informative, on hand when you need them, and always concerned with how we liked our meal.   Ambiance: It's not the place where it's so quiet, you'll want to whisper, but it's definitely a more trendy type of crowd. If I can be nitpicky, the tables for two were too long for a normal conversation as we had to shout over the table distance as well as over the music. Although most of the dinner was eaten in silence, we both knew our palates were in heaven.   Drinks are Vegas prices ($$$) and well made, but nothing to rush for. If you could do it, find a nice bottle of wine instead. (The list is pretty expensive, though -- cheapest probably started at ~$50) Overall, a nice dinner for locals.

VehnFtzcGHwwdZQrluu26g.text: We had the signature tasting menu which was a perfect way to try a lot of their menu.  Hands down the first course was by far and away the best:  the market oysters and wagyu beef tartare were heaven.    The decor is quite subdued.  You know you are here for a fine dining experience, no loud gimmicks or distractions.  Service was top notch and the price will not break the bank.

rX8TMEVeKxTx3tvAqZL2rA.text: I went here last night and the food was phenomenal. The service was a little subpar but I think our waiter was just having a bad night at work. Don't we all? The grilled Spanish octopus, beet salad, snapper and coconut lime sorbet were amazing. The portions were perfect and I left feeling satisfied not over stuffed. The decor at this restaurant is pretty great too. I will definitely be back. I cannot stress enough how good the food was! Do yourself a favor and eat here!

5XWlyyOxu01kIk2S7BJH-A.text: Loved it - and it doesn't HAVE to break the bank.  The sleekness starts at the entrance, when you walk in between see-through floor-to-ceiling wine coolers. This "door" is the only thing you see from the casino floor, so the restaurant feels a little hidden. The dining area is modern and quiet (but not awkwardly so).  Our service was excellent from the hostess to the waiter to the bussers, and everyone was very knowledgeable when it came to the menu. The waiter suggested a virgin Moscow Mule for my pregnancy cocktail and the Empire State for my husband, who was interested in a rye cocktail. Both were spot-on.   For dinner, I got the pre-theatre menu, which I recommend to everyone. It's $49 for 3 courses (bargain), but only available from 5-7pm. I selected the pear & brussel sprout salad, the tilefish, and the pineapple mousse dessert. My husband went with the a la carte menu (not bargain) and got a mushroom salad (~$20) and the skirt steak (~$50). We also shared the beef tongue appetizer. I have never tried beef tongue and have always been apprehensive about biting into something that seems so chewy and just weird, but I was so glad we got this. The meat was served in little cubes with rye toast, celery, and white beans, and was awesome. I could have eaten twice as much. If you're waffling on trying tongue, this is an excellent way to start! Both of our salads were delicious - the brussel sprout/bacon/pear combination tasted great, but seemed kind of standard. The mushroom salad, on the other hand, was really unique. The mushrooms were so hearty, they actually tasted like meat! And there were so many different mushrooms, all with different tastes. The skirt steak was awesome, served in a sweet-ish sauce with these fried sweet potato ball things, which were also awesome. The disappointment of the night was probably the tilefish - it was good and all, just not anything to wow me. I guess they probably did all you can do with tilefish. The dessert, however, was incredible. The plate had pineapple mousse, little bites of pineapple cake, pineapple ice cream, and actual pineapples! Oh yeah, drizzled with some kind of pineapple-y sauce. Don't be scared, though, it wasn't overpowering at all, just delicious! I wished I could have sat and slowly savored each little bite, but I had to hurry a little to make it to the show on time!  I had been saving Sage as a special-occasion, expensive kind of night out, but it doesn't have to be. If you come in early for the pre-theatre menu or just hit the bar for happy hour apps & drinks, you can get out for $150 for 2 people. Additional tip: all wine (ALL!) is half off for locals on week nights!

CUOVkcANXPFwvi4N30Y1jA.text: I was in Vegas last weekend for a bachelor party, and we decided that we'd dine at Sage for one of the nice dinners we were having. Sage came as a recommendation by a friend who currently works as a chef in Vegas. The overall ambiance was good, and I liked that it wasn't overcrowded by tables and rowdy diners, yet wasn't too stuffy and quiet that you can hear a pin drop. We were definitely on the louder side, but that's what you get when you have nine guys drinking wine and scotch.  The $89 tasting menu is definitely a good deal, with plenty of viable options to choose from. There were actually couple items on the tasting menu that was not available on the a la carte menu. Unfortunately we had some friends who are rather picky eaters, and the tasting menu requires full table participation. Sage also offers a 10 course chef's tasting menu.  Vancouver Island Kushi Oysters - we ordered a plate to share for the table and ended up getting another. One of the best oysters I've had in a really long time. The Kushi oysters were incredibly fresh with a hint of sweetness in each shell. The mignonette served on the oyster is what really made this dish work. I usually find mignonettes too overpowering with vinegar. The aged tequila mignonette was undertoned and let you taste the natural sweetness of the oyster.  Grilled Spanish Octopus - this was the main starter that I ordered after contemplating getting the foie gras creme brulee. Coming from LA, I really miss my foie. But after talking to the waiter about how the foie was prepared, I wasn't really sold on it. I'd much rather have a hearty piece of foie seared on a pan on a toast. The octopus was cooked well but nothing was very memorable with it.   Snake River Farms New York Strip - not your typical dry aged steak from a steakhouse, but cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. I saw beef marrow on the list of ingredients so I was expecting a nice grilled beef marrow with a toast on the side, but I guess they put it in the sauce that they cover the meat in. I wasn't a big fan of the sauce as I like to enjoy my meat the way it is, but it wasn't terrible. The quality of the meat definitely made the dish work. La ratte potatoes were also excellent. May have been one of the smoothest mashed potatoes I've ever had.  Coconut Key Lime Float - I usually opt out of dessert and finish the meal with an espresso, but since everyone was getting something I felt compelled to order something as well. The coconut key lime float was recommended by the waiter as I was looking for something that was not too sweet. This ended up being the most creative and interesting dish of the night. The entire dessert comes on a bed of ice and they pour shishito pepper foam over the coconut and the key lime sorbet. The shishito pepper was foam was really interesting. You wouldn't expect a very peppery taste profile would go well with dessert, but it cut the tartness of the key lime and added great flavor to the somewhat mild coconut.  Overall we had an excellent dinner and everyone left very satisfied. One hiccup was that the restaurant overcharged us by $600. They somehow messed up and included one of the other table's orders on our bill. Good thing that I had caught it, if not some lucky table would have had a free meal on us. It took the restaurant almost 20 minutes to sort everything out, which, in my mind, is entirely too long of a wait to fix a wrong. No apologies were given either, which was very surprising. Perhaps Aria could work on training their service staff a little more.

xszGHmx0YmoU76rmI_oT-A.text: I am going to keep this review short and sweet.  But I do want to mention that I can see why so many people love this restaurant.  The menu is small, and most what I had was crafted deliciously, and it looks like pride is taken in making the food.  Favorite appetizer was the grilled octopus.  It is served with potato puree, what a great and unique complement to the seafood.  Favorite main dish was the flank steak.  Good lord what a dish.  So tender you don't even need a knife.  It's one of those dishes that you want again as you write a review, I hate that feeling!!  Service as you will read is spot on.  My one dish that I wouldn't order is the pork loin.  So salty, not sure if it is meant to be like that.  Still gets an easy 5 though.  The restaurant doesn't act pretentious, and keeps it simple.  I love that.

mkRBrB7YL9YA6nZy6dW3Tg.text: First night in Vegas and my friends and I decided on Sage. Most definitely a great choice!! Upon first stepping foot in the restaurant I was blown away by the high ceilings, and dim lighting...very sexy chic...very Veags. Our watier was very attentive and offered drink and food suggestions. In the end, I ordered the taylor gold pear and shaved brussels sprouts and the braised veal cheeks. Both dishes were beyond excellent. The veal melted in my mouth and with a combination of polenta the dish was perfect. The portion sizes were just right I wasn't stuffed by the time we left and even had room for a few drinks.   Even though the meal was on the expensive side I would definitely say it was worth the money for anyone looking to have a fantastic meal in Vegas.

Jvu7NE6CCgY6Iy-_lZCvSw.text: We made a last minute reservation at Sage before seeing Zarkana. As it was a Saturday, most of the restaurants were already booked, limiting our options. We were seated promptly (only had to wait a few minutes past arriving) at a quiet table in the corner. After briefly going over the menu, our waiter disappeared for a short period (checking in with the table next to us twice in this time frame). We chalked it up as him trying not to rush us.  After ordering our drinks, we decided on the two course meal. My girlfriend opted for the slow poached egg, while I had the roasted pear. The pear was a decent dish, but the egg was really lacking. Besides having little flavor, the truffle on top was of a foamy consistency, mirroring that of saliva. Coupled with it being a comically sized serving, our early impressions of the food weren't too favorable.  The main courses came a short while later, chicken and venison. Both of these dishes were enjoyable, albeit in very conservative portions. For others eating here, it definitely seems that they are geared towards multiple small courses. I would certainly recommend the option for at least three courses per person, as the portion sizes are very small.  The restaurant was kind enough to remove the poached egg from the bill. In summary, I feel that there are much better options in and around the Aria for dinner, especially in this price range.

TcdYxPEdTRg8ULvH1usjuw.text: If you love good food, good service, good ambience, you got to come here. This is one of my favorite restaurant in vega. I've been eating here several time in different occasions. nothing never go wrong here.

dk5HvI0YTntPSiS7LQoLIA.text: Delicious!  We had a reservation for 13 girls for my sister's bachelorette and we all went with the Signature Tasting Menu.  Sage was very accommodating and held our reservation even though half of our girls were over half an hour late.  I had the Moscow Mule, which I LOVED that they served it in a little copper mug with crushed ice.    Our server was amazing.  I forget her name but she provided us with excellent service along with the rest of the staff.. especially the busser!  For my first course, I had the Market Oysters.  The flavors melded really well together and I thought the presentation was fantastic.  I loved that the oysters were set up on a bed of sea salt.  I also had a taste of the Wagyu Beef Tartare (delicious!) and the Spring Asparagus Salad that the other girls were having.  Second course, we all chose the Maine Dayboat Scallops except for one girl who decided to try the Bacon-Wrapped Rabbit Saddle.  The scallops were phenomenal! You get 2 enormous, entree-sized scallops.  The portion was so big that barely any of us could finish it.  I was dying to try the next 2 courses so I knew I had to save some more room.  The scallops were seared perfectly.  I am normally not a scallop fan, but this dish definitely changed the way I think.  I am also not a big fan of rabbit either, I haven't had it in years.. but it was pretty good.  Scallops were way better though :)  Third course, I had the Wagyu Australian Sirloin.  Wow.. practically melted in my mouth.  You can see the marbling of the fat throughout the meat, which was cooked perfectly.  I would say the only negative thing about this dish was that it was too salty.  The sirloin was so delicious though, I couldn't help myself but to eat the entire plate even thought it was on salt overload.  Dessert..  we all went with the Gianduja Pave. Yum! I'm more of a savory person than a dessert person, so I only had a taste of this.  Delicious!  I loved the olive oil pairing with it.  Just added the right amount of flavor to the chocolate.  I would definitely come back and try out the rest of this menu and some other drinks.  This place was absolutely fantastic.

Sdw7VFt6WrpCOKjEi9KYFA.text: I don't go out much or get to.. to say the least, but Sage.. saved me from every aspect of isolation of a homebody. Nestled in Aria Hotel, on the casino level by the front desk, adjacent from Julian Serrano. The array of deep, neon hues of purple awaits as you walk by the bar and into the main dining room. Three words to describe the ambiance: Sultry, sexy, and sooooothing. The bar and lounge area is quite inviting. I wouldn't mind at all having my meal there.   My classy date and I were greeted by a kind, smiling lovely hostess named Alexis. I appreciate that so much, since the warm welcoming gives a great start to a wonderful dining experience.  We were then escorted in by the assistant manager and even pulled out the table and chair for us. My Oh my it just gets better and better!!!   This was my first time trying a Signature Tasting Menu and honestly, I couldn't be more excited and thrilled to be able to share this experience with someone that loves great creations of food as much as I do. *Sigh I'm so happy... We tasted everything, shared everything, and that in itself meant Everything to me.   The 1st Course: WAGYU BEEF TARTARE  w/ Pickled Mustard Seeds. Crushed Caper Aioli , Slow Poached Egg, & Crispy Chocolate  -Extraordinary. By far the best beef tartare I ever had. The presentation itself was breathtaking and simply a work of art. Once you mix the egg with beef, the texture is ever so creamy. After my first bite, combining everything even the piece of thin, airy chocolate on top of a tasty olive oil infused, crispy brioche toast. I was singing.. Isn't she lovely... yeeeeees. All the ingredients, solid flavors were bursting with surprise in my mouth. It's nothing like I ever tasted before. If this is how it feels when you fall in love... I'm deeply in love.  We also went all out and substituted for yes..... the FOIE GRAS BRULEE!!! The soft, slightly salty brioche muffin contrast with the richness of the foie gras.. make whoopie by eating this. A very sensual dish. This hypnotizing flavor is all new to me..  dizzy in love again.. perhaps that was the champagne?! Reggie, our sommelier was informative and great.   The 2nd Course: BACON- WRAPPED RABBIT       English Pea Ravioli/Nueske Bacon, & Sweet Onion Sauce - Vibrant green colors.. gave away this freshness to the eyes. Beautiful dish. Every single element in this entree were magically paired to one another. It was as if you were eating your favorite song. Rabbit.. oh Rabbit.. I love you... Damn it.. I do. *hitting the dining table with my fists... gawd I want more and more of you. Addicted..  MAINE DAYBOAT SCALLOPS  Braised Oxtail/Wild Mushrooms, & Salted Caramel Reduction -My favorite seafood.. Scallops! Cooked to perfection, tender, juicy, and oh so damn succulent. Forget day dreaming.. I fantasize about this dish. Can't get enough of it. I want this dish and I want it Bad. Delicious!  The 3rd Course:  We both ordered... 48 HOUR BEEF BELLY   Shaved Purple Asparagus/Ramp-Sorrel Puree, & Pickled Ramps/Toasted Almond - Very rich and the depth of flavor is endless. Extremely tender and effortlessly melts in your mouth. This isn't for the faint of heart, but for a heart of gold due to the luxuriance of the meat. Happily satisfied :)  The 4th course: GIANDUJA PAVE  Olive Oil Ice Cream, Hazelnut Crunch, & Basil Jam -Odd combination, but it was the best ending to such an amazing, memorable dinner. Again, everything I tasted was like a stimulating, new fairy tale story. It made such a profound impact of how I felt at that present moment and I could say... I could have fallin' in love. I never knew food could alter the way I feel and gosh darn it... I felt So beyond special. I never smiled so bright. My tummy was beaming!   We were also offered complimentary breads in the beginning of sourdough or bacon bread. Bacon, by far was it for me and the whipped, creamy butter with sea salt .. yes another smile on this face. *sigh We also did the wine pairing with our Tasting :) I could cry out of joy from this experience. Pure bliss... Maybe since the flavors and simple ingredients were like traveling and exploring a new country.. a first for me. I was just stunned and even turned on by how delicious this restaurant was. The dim, cozy decor, and colors makes this ideal for a perfect Romantic date. I seriously couldn't be more pleased and happy. I love the fact my date has great taste in food and loves exploring as much as eating. Great company and great food can definitely lead to great things ;) The service was exceptional, top notch, 5 solid stars... The GM, Robert was ever so personable, funny, and kind by checking up on us throughout our evening. Our servers, runners, bussers, all worked smoothly together and made this one of the best dining experience I ever had in my entire life. Thank you. That being said.. This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas and I can't wait to go back.

Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy.
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 48 HOUR BEEF BELLY

j8TqiFpIZJjCsm4cvMHTzQ.text: Can a single meal completely change your perception of fine dining?  Can a single meal radically alter your relationship with food in general?  I think it can -- and Sage proves it.  After my dinner here, I'll never look at food quite the same way again.  To say it was my favorite meal in Las Vegas would be an understatement.  It would be more accurate to say it was one of my top meals of *all time*.  It began with an 8pm reservation for two.  Sage, located in the Aria hotel, has a relatively unassuming entrance, but that belies that grandeur to be found inside.  The restaurant is immense, with high ceilings, sumptuous furnishings, and a gorgeous color scheme with lots of golds accents and stunning chandeliers.  Needless to say, Sage is just as much a feast for the eyes as it is for the taste buds.   After we were seated, our incredibly friendly and kind server, John, came by with the breadbasket.  We each had the sourdough roll and a bacon brioche -- and both were excellent.  They were served with sea salt (served on a tablespoon) and whipped butter.   Deciding what to order was easy as pie -- we both had the 4-course tasting menu ($79).  My dinner companion splurged on the wine pairing ($39).  Our server's wine pours were *very* generous -- a lot more than the advertised half glass per course .  In fact, I was able to enjoy some wine with every course without bothering to order the wine pairing myself.   Below is a run-down of everything that we ate.  Absolutely everything was cooked and presented with the utmost class and sophistication.  The refinement of this dinner was unlike anything I'd previously experienced.  **AMUSE BOUCHE ... PRE-DINNER** A shot glass of gazpacho.  Fresh and tangy.  A wonderful starter.  **COURSE #1** Wagyu beef tartare with buttered crostini.  Easily the finest tartare I've ever had.  The beef was unctuous and fresh; the egg only added to the indulgence.  Chocolate shavings provided an unexpected layer of complexity.  **COURSE #2** Seared Maine dayboat scallops with broccolini, braised oxtail, mushrooms, and caramel reduction.  The scallops were cooked beautifully and fall apart when touched with a fork.  The broccolini was tender.  The caramel sauce provided an intriguing sweetness that contrasted against the saltiness of the shellfish.  **COURSE #3** 48 hour beef belly with braised apples.  I've never had beef this tender and succulent in my life.  Each bite dissolves on your palate and overwhelms you with flavor.  Apples provide a gentle acidity that works well against the umami of the beef.  **COURSE #4** Pistachio tart with strawberry ice cream.  A culinary work of art -- oodles of individual components meticulously arranged.  Bold, fresh flavors all over the plate.  An enjoyable juxtaposition of hot and cold.   **AMUSE BOUCHE ... POST-DINNER** Hot white chocolate with mint and coconut, served in a white porcelain shot glass.  A sweet, uplifting treat at the end of a fantastic meal.  After this meal, I wasn't just full and satisfied -- I was exhilarated, knowing that I had a world-class gastronomic experience.  The staff at Sage earned every penny of their tip.  This isn't the sort of meal I can have everyday -- but it's worth doing once in a while, if for no other reason to remind yourself that fine dining can truly be life-changing.  If you subscribe to the "you only live once" philosophy, than a dinner at Sage is a must.

PMgCCON_9H9XyJ3PM5q5lA.text: We had such a spectacular experience dining (twice) at Sage this week! Although we decided to eat at the bar, our bartender/server (Richard) gave us his undivided attention all evening, provided thorough knowledge of the menu, and even put on a fire show for us when he poured our Absinthe after dinner cocktail!! Robert was a perfectly attentive and enjoyable server- with serious mixology skills and liquor knowledge. Thanks again Robert!   The specialty craft cocktails (especially the Old Fashioned) were some of the best we have ever tasted. We had the wagyu beef tartare, roasted sweetbread, wagyu short ribs, and gnocchi side...which all were out of this world!   WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!

l_K3nnmY5cybSb3FXt5MEw.text: The vibe of the restaurant is mysterious I'd say, as it's dimly lit with purple wall backdrops and a candle on each table. Our server Marcus was very articulate and patient with our orders. He comes to check on how we were doing once in a while without seeming pushy or making us feel intruded. The other servers/staff were pretty friendly but not annoying as well.

G_shGuihwa2h19pTLqCpwg.text: The Wagyu beef tartare is worth the trip alone, it is not be skipped a.  Finish off with a traditional or Fire and Ice prep of absinthe, and you have a solid evening Vegas style!

lNbVmvRw41AHVzsQ04S4pg.text: Lovely resturant, beautiful atmosphere and attentive service but a very disappointing dinner. Selected this for a special birthday dinner above many others in Vegas. Picked the Valentines chef selected menu and was very excited. The first appetizer  was great as well as the second course. When the main course came, it was a huge portion of lamb chops. Both mine and my husbands were undercooked. We sent both plates back. When they came back, they were more done but at that point, we opted to leave and skip the final dessert course. Because we agreed to do a wine pairing , this meal and experience was overpriced at nearly 600.00 and disappointing.  No mention was made to make up for the meal in anyway. We left feeling a bit taken advantage of . My advice, proceed with caution.

_pYoVuGAKer9hvFfo20wPQ.text: Modern American restaurant at the aria.  Friendly staff. Food was great. Steak tartare appetizer was amazing. We got the duck and wagyu steak entrees. Both were really good.  Food is on the pricey end.

Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GDpxaN-V3wy6TiY7uohGgw.text: Absolutely everything I would want in an upscale restaurant: Great vegetarian options, fantastic service, a private feeling even in a crowded room, dim lighting and a good wine list.  I was able to get a same night reservation on a weekend in February, awesome! Everything I ordered was delicious. We never had to wait more than 90 seconds after we thought of something we wanted -the servers must have been standing nearby waiting. I'd go back for sure.

9-0bhxIiySeqtiYt4nxBBA.text: Wish I could give the waitress( lailani or however you spell it) a zero. My family and I came for my birthday celebration and we are also staying in Aria in a suite...the lady was very rude and barely came to our table..we had to keep waiving people down to come to our table and Our waitress noticed but did not bother to stop and say anything...worst bday celebration ever and did not sing me happy birthday will never come back to this place

WVVeVL_bj123Rrs_GZlUjg.text: After visiting twice I feel that sage is a very underrated concept at the Aria.  Rob and his staff provide an excellent service experience and the food is delicious.  The creme brulee foie and lamb necks are awesome.  The cocktails are great and the absinthe experience was excellent.  All base were covered both visits

_FmCvc16DGB0X7otonahaQ.text: I really enjoyed eating here. We had a group of 4 and arrived fairly late on a weeknight. It was pretty empty inside with maybe 3 or 4 other tables being occupied. The restaurant itself is GORGEOUS and incredibly spacious. I was a huge fan of the decor and atmosphere. It was quiet and dimly lit, with beautiful purple candle lights on every table. The entrance to the kitchen and staff areas are covered with a huge golden curtain that spans across the back of the restaurant. When you first enter the restaurant, you have to walk through a large wine display, where 100s of wine bottles are arranged in aisles.       The food itself was also delicious. I like to try pork belly everywhere I go, and Sage had the best pork belly I have ever had. I had the Black Bass as my entree and it was also very good. I will definitely be back in the future. The only complaint from the table, came from a regular who goes there often, he said they haven't changed their menu in several years so there wasn't anything new he could try. I did not pay the bill or even see it, so I can't comment on pricing.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful atmosphere! Dimly lit with purple candle lights on every table.

G4XuzqF2cKVQAQbAVtz6AQ.text: The wagyu tartare is a MOST have! The best l've ever had! I'll be back just to eat that! We had the wagyu filet mignon and the short rib and it was amazing! Service by everyone was very good and there was a nice vibe and romantic ambiance!

VJyW5yfE7Qt0PFqx9Pe-8Q.text: The concierge at our hotel recommended Sage. My fiance and I usually like to dine at MGM properties so we can get our points. Sage is located right by the check-in area at the Aria. We made reservations ahead of time. It was my fiance and I and two of our friends. We were able to get a nice seat in the front of the restaurant. The ambience is awesome. It's dimly lit and sexy. We had a server who may have either been having an off night or was new to the service industry. We had a really hard time tracking him down the entire night. Every time we ordered something it wtook a really long time for it to get to us. We ended up being there for over two hours. We were just trying to get something somewhat quick to eat. We realized it was fine dining but we didn't want to be there all night. Also, they serve you bread and the bread was delicious. We opted out of appetizers but definitely ordered cocktails. I ordered a martini and when it came to me only half of it was full. But it was still about $16. Full price, half full. My fiance and I split a seafood dish, and you could barely taste the fish because the sauce was so heavy. It literally and figuratively put a bad taste in my mouth. I wouldn't come here again for the food or the cocktails because at this restaurant, unfortunately the glass is half full. The prices are high, the service isn't great, I will give it an A+ for environment and that's about it. Sorry Sage.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Do not get this dish
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved the place itself
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner is served... After two hours.

Ak6CtRvSTZqnbrCE-FSGTg.text: The restaurant is stunning, service was great. I let my daughter pick this restaurant without looking at the menu first, I don't eat meat but was able to find things to eat. Started with the carrot salad. There were too many different flavors on the plate, it was muddy because of that, editing would help this dish. I then had the poached egg, which itself was fine, however the crostini that came with it was too greasy and I couldn't eat it. Also, sometime during our meal our water glasses were refilled from a pitcher of old smelly water, it smelled fishy. My stomach is still upset, not sure if it was the greasy bread or bad water.

We really enjoyed the scallops and their amazing signature dessert, it was one of the best desserts we've ever had! If I had won enough money, I would have done the bourbon flight. Maybe next time?

nJUAN4bj1VNuxcaUalgEJg.text: The ambience is elegant in a romantic modern way. I have been here twice - once for a quick bite and drinks in the bar area and once for dinner.  The food was delicious. Service was wonderful. The kusshi oysters were sweet, the wagyu beef tartare was good and savory (I dont always like eating beef tartare but I would definitely get it here again), the heirloom carrot salad was so good and well seasoned and the roasted halibut was tasty. Drinks were ok my goose and soda wasn't as strong as I prefer, I didn't try a cocktail but maybe I'd do that next time.

AmXYpkQwHRH_X_B2yU8j0w.text: Wagyu Beef Tartare was five stars  Wild Mushroom Risotto was four stars  Maine Day Boat Scallops was four stars  Baked Alaska was four stars

p4740qwzL68o72jP9lhFfg.text: Had a delicious dinner here one evening with friends. We always stay at the Aria every tome we're in Vegas so it was very convenient for us. We originally had a reservation for 15 but after 2 nights of bottle service and day drinking, only 8 of us made it out this evening. They accommodated us well.   Ambiance was nice. Dark. Wonderful acoustics playing with cellist and guitarist. Pop music. Classical music. So talented. It was a bit chilly in there and they accommodated us again.   Had a delicious cocktail with ice cubes made of mint or cucumber so it was deliciously potent. I like how the cocktail menu divides cocktails in terms of refreshing, sweet, crisp etc. The waiter was helpful with deciding what to get and at the end graciously split our check between the different couples.   We ordered the foie gras brulee. Served with sweet brioche, which they brought us more of. Creamy, salty, rich foie gras topped with sweet carmelized sugar. Delicious. Steak tartare, which was a pretty generous serving.   My husband ordered the scallops. Cooked to perfection. Delicious. It was their signature item and featured on billboards, which we happened to see and looked exactly like how it was presented. I ordered the black bass. Tender. Served with crispy skin. Over farro. Good textural differences.   Loved it. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras brûlée
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Sea bass
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonderful birthday celebration.

r_5xizX3KBcCufFGj4rNsA.text: Considering the price level of his place, I had to give it three stars. We started with the beef tartare and the soup. We shared two portions of the beef tartare and that was enough for 4 people especially if you ask for more bread. We then ordered a bottle of wine and a few drinks. The drinks were  and I would say one of the best features of this place. We then ordered our entrees and most of us had the Wagyu steak medium rare. On the inside the steak was cooked just right. The seer was too much and a little on the burnt side. I had the scallops which was supposed to be the best and I agree the scallops were good but the sides and the sauces composing the rest of the plate were severely lacking. If that were different, It would have made the dish worth the value. The service on the other hand was mixed. The runners and busboys were all really good and attentive. The actual waitress was the worst I've seen at a nice restaurant. She lacked the skills to be able to successfully provide good recommendations and service us to the level of this restaurant.   Service: 2 stars for the main waitress. 5 stars for the supporting staff   Food: beef tartare was great! Wagyu could have been better and the scallops were good and could be much better with upgraded sides   Ambience: 5 star ambience! Great decor and surroundings   Drinks 5 star top notch drinks and options

gO2qR7ld9KGf51Y3ayvYqQ.text: Incredible ambiance upon entering. Sage is quiet and comfortable yet sleek and sexy. The service was impeccable and the entire wait staff was courteous, professional and prompt. The food was decent but not what I'd expect for $$$$. Maybe the tourist tax of Vegas?? The foie gras brulee was beautiful, creative and delicious. I ordered from The Chef's menu and had risotto that was crunchy (is it supposed to be crunchy???)   All in all a wonderful place to go for date night when you have some time and cash laying around. Because the service was so good I'll definitely be trying it a second time.

pvOxa33NbcdaBXPEK0GMxg.text: What a great dining experience. Every plate on the chef's menu was amazing. My only regret was not taking more photos to share but I was too busy enjoying the flavors and ambiance to do so. The service was also great. All of the staff were very knowledgeable, attentive and elevated the overall experience even further.

hqWS2SHkop_bH6FCY4mNOw.text: We came here a few weeks ago for my birthday and sat in their front room to enjoy the Abstain experience. It was our first time trying Abstain and we had a variety of different taste buds with our group. Rob was very attentive and explained everything we needed to know to choose which kind of Abstain Drink we each wanted. He was very knowledgeable and made the experience fun! q9uir7HUZyDD_52wPfhdmg.text: My love for Risotto started only after my visit to sage. This steak house style Italian restaurant made one of the best vegetarian risotto that was creamy, filling, with the perfect texture and taste and the perfect portion for making it an unforgettable meal.   The ambiance of this restaurant screams luxury and  the service was superb. The steaks and other pasta dishes the table enjoyed were amazing and everyone at the table felt like they had he best meal of their trip in Vegas. Says a lot when everyone at the table leaves happy without any complaints.   It's a great dinner spot in the city center and reckoned to those who are going to go watch a show in the casino and need a nice dinner prior to attending their show.

7ESNFqc40-vgo2G19rKX_w.text: Ordered from the prefix menu. Prices for the strip were pretty good actually. The meal was a three course deal.  For the first course I went with the seafood salad. Was not disappointed because it had a nice amount of seafood and it was very flavorful and overall I enjoyed it.  For my main course I went with the spinach lasagna.  I don't regret this at all.  Flavorful...   sauce and everything hit the spot.  This was a winner.  For dessert I had the tiramisu.   Not the best I've ever had but definitely was something I would order again.   My friends went with the creme brulee and they all seemed to be big fans of it.  The margarita pizza was not impressive looking but I didn't try it so I can't comment on the flavors.   Most of the people that I was with got the meat, cheese and olive thing for their app and they devoured it.   The portions for the prefix menu were the same as for the regular menu.   If I was ever on the strip again with a group of people and had to eat there, I would definitely recommend this place

iWi_Jb2Zsq8QEPugPL6LsQ.text: Premium food and atmosphere. Delicious food. great service. Best restaurant I had while I was in vegas. Best Foie gras Ive had. I had impressive salmon and amazing desserts!!

aJjAEYoJKHrIAUy4NYSskA.text: A special occasion restaurant that's trendy AND spendy, Sage should be your first choice when dining at Aria.  Our server JBond (!) was sweet and professional. A sign of a good server shouldn't only tell you about the specials of the night, but actually to make those things sound so delectably good, you'd want to order everything!  All our choices were on point: nothing lacking in seasoning, everything cooked to perfect the temperature, portion is just right.   Sweetbreads is something that I'll never make at home, so I always order it whenever I see it on the menu. I wish this one was a bit more crispier, but the polenta soaked up all the juices from the sweetbreads and the thick cut of glazed bacon was something I really loved.   The bf's seared scallops were large circles of luxuriously soft goodness.  My lamb saddle was braised to perfection, capturing all the flavor of the meat being super tender.   Their amazing signature dish, the Foie gras brulee, deserves all the hype that everyone on yelp mentions. Generous serving of foie topped with caramelized bits of sugar, cherry coulis and thick sweet-salty brioche tops. I'm sad that foie gras is now banned in California, but Sage gives me a reason next time to come back!  We didn't order dessert since we were saving room in our bellies for more cocktails (go figure!) at a lounge later on.  But our server was so sweet, he sent us complimentary white chocolate mugs to end our meal on a sweet note.  Sage is worth every pretty penny. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aviation
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The enticing cocktail menu
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras brûlée

q4ZkGUkKBj1NbXmhOt6pbg.text: One of my favorite dinners in a very long time.  Very unique combinations of flavors I wouldn't normally order but was so happy with 90% of our selections! We practically ordered the entire menu and with just 4 of us we were shocked at how very little we wasted.   Starters - Kushi oysters had a great spice to them!  Beef tartare was delicious. Veal sweetbreads were tasty and reminded me of pork rinds lol but I love that flavor so I liked them. Poached egg was tasty with the truffles and the crunchy bread they serve it with is very yummy to dip into the egg.  Grilled octopus was so tender and the spinach and chorizo combo was amazing and I'm not even a fan of octopus!  That was one of my favs of the night but I'm a sucker for chorizo.   The king crab asparagus salad was amazing - loved the citrus dressing, I also didn't know the crab would be tempura style so that was Delicious Artichoke salad was very good the iberico ham & snap peas tasty.   Entrees- the gnocchi were good but I was distracted by the awesome pork belly that came with them My favorite entree was the rabbit, 1st time I ever had it and it was Amazing.  The braised leg was so amazing the flavors and cooked to perfection.  The confit shoulder tasted like fried chicken heaven.  Salmon was very good with the couscous and veggies.  I didn't care for the veal cheeks, Just not my thing. Hubby had Wagyu short rib so I only had a small piece but was very tender and flavorful as most are.   Favorite desserts, we had quite a few and I loved the foie gras candy bar tasted like a snickers!  Lemon Meyer cheesecake always love.  Didn't care for bread pudding, but once again not my thing.  Strawberry shortcake good but just ordinary. Cheese platter was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese platter, strawberry shortcake, Meyer lemon cheesecake, bread pudding, foie gras candy bar sweet piece of snickers heaven

Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Starters - Kushi oysters, organic poached egg, king crab &amp; asparagus salad, artichoke salad, beef tartare

cq4ZHN4iloeZGx0-JlnoVw.text: I thought I had written a review but saw I had not. So doing one now.  This is my second time I've eaten at Sage.  OMG.... The experience all around was fantastic!  First the ambiance is top notch.  The decor is wonderfully done and the lighting was well thought out.  Love the purple art display by the bar in the main entrance.  Service was impeccable.  Their A game was always on.  Checking the table, making sure water glasses always full, demeanor was always friendly.  Food was perfection.  Everything from apps/main course/dessert.  I'll definitely be back and I always recommend to all friends.

PEc49Cy8Qf_fxkBth7Ruhg.text: We decided to try Sage out after seeing Zarkana at Aria. We decided on the $89 signature menu. I chose the wagyu beef tartare with slow poached egg and chocolate, Maine dayboat scallops, the 48 hour beef belly and the lemon pie with chartreuse gelee, pistachio ice cream and toasted marshmallow.  My favorite of the meal was the wagyu beef tartare. Very tasty and salty, but I love salt. The scallops and the beef belly were pretty good as well. I'm not saying this was a bad meal by any means, but it didn't blow me away. I feel that the meal was more about the presentation and look.

MQw6TvySSnTiExcGsjYA8A.text: Hands down... this was the best meal I've ever had in las Vegas! We had the pre-fixed meal and everything was unique and flavorful. We added the butternut squash bisque and it was heavenly! Just the right amount of sweet and salty. For appetizer, I had the foie gras creme brulee which was subverting I've never had before but was really rich and sweet. Main course was braised short ribs which also had an added sweetness. I ended with chocolate ricotta. There was definitely a sweet theme if you haven't noticed... I have a big sweet tooth. This meal was a bit pricey but worth every penny! Don't forget to bring your mlife card to rank in your mlife points on your pricey meal! Might as well.. Haha

0yJIqUC8X5oEKeUmr3Xojg.text: One of the nicest restaurant in my opinion. The colors of the place are deep purples and golds and makes the place look very elegant. If you looking for a nice romantic night out i'd definitely recommend this place.  We tried quite a few different dishes. The first were the chilled oysters, served with their own style hot sauce, very good. My favorite dish was the beef carpaccio, which usually you would expect the raw meat to be a thin layer, but this is more like ground beef compacted into a circle. Served on top of the beef was a lightly cooked but raw quail egg, served along side two bread crisps.   For our entrees, i had the RABBIT! It was the oddest thing on the menu but it did not taste odd. I asked the server what it tasted like and she said chicken. Which she was not wrong, it was was moistly cooked and the consistency was like chicken, but the much thinner than the usual stringy-ness that chicken has. My friend had a crab salad, i didn't get to try it though :(

f_yvnpLT2ynCtxRlmJ91XA.text: Sage is a beautiful restaurant located in the Aria resort and casino, which serves modern American cuisine aligned with the farm-to-table mentality. I came here during a work conference event. A business partner organized a group dinner of about 30 people. This was one of the best dining experiences I've had in a while. We were presented with a prix fix menu and I opted the waygu beef tartare, roasted day boat scallops, braised veal cheeks, and apple fritters for dessert. The restaurant was beautiful and service was exceptional. The food not only looked beautiful but matched in both freshness and flavor. I would not hesitate to return if I find myself in Vegas again.

01dh9DaUEGQOFwKw2QUDJQ.text: Man. I've been dying to try this place for a long time.   This is "fine dining" with a not so fine experience or food.   I made reservations a few weeks ago for an early Valentine's Day date. And honestly, I can't say I've been more disappointed in a restaurant on the strip.   We got there early and sat at the bar to wait. We could barely get the bartenders to wait on us. We had to ask for drinks twice, and they never brought the water.   We got our table, and the waiter was super bizarre. He seemed very unsure of himself and his job. He was very jittery...like he was in training. You would expect seasoned waiters. We were also seated with no menus. Once he brought them 5 minutes later, he never explained and walked off. We already had scotch, and we had to ask him for a liquor menu. He brought us the wine menu. These are things you should never have to ask for.  We did the 4-course meal. And each item was good. Honestly? The best thing we had was their bread. Haha. And their scotch selection was awesome.  The worst part: it took almost an hour to get our second course. We were starving. If you see on the pics, the servings are smaller. And I'm a small person, but I can eat. That to me, is a long time to wait for a course. The last two came out faster.  The best dish I had? Maybe the Wagyu filet? It was good. I think it's the first time I don't feel like going into detail about the food.   Also, the staff here was not great. Each time we got up to walk to the restroom (lots of times because we were there for almost 3 hours...) each waiter would walk in front of us, and cut us off. Literally. They would rush in front of us. No matter where I've been to dine, this almost never happens. Especially when they have a tray of food. Most of these people weren't even looking out for customers. Insane.   We've been to so many places on the strip and spent the same kind of money for special occasions. We spent around $400 total. And I'm sorry, but jesus. I would really love to expect a phenomenal experience for service and food. Especially because we were recommended on both.  I feel even worse because I referred another friend to this place last week. She said she pretty much had the same experience as me. Horrible.  I can't even tell you how melancholy I was leaving for home last night. Boo.

mRU_h0CGuRqP4bVcGyJHcg.text: One of the better meals of my life. Trust me. My waistline does not lie.   We stumbled (it's Vegas, everyone stumbles) onto this place while wanting a fine dinning experience in the midst of Vegas debauchery. Every bachelorette party needs a little class and this place was going to give if to us on a silver platter.   Ambiance is fancy. Of the fancy shmancy variety. The service was impeccable.   Now onto what's important. The food. Oh. The. Food. Every girl had a salad to start. We are dainty none the less. Mine was the beet salad and I literally could have licked my plate. But that would have been inappropriate. My wagu short ribs where nothing short of perfection. Tender. Tasty. This cow was certainly a happy cow I thank her or him. For dessert we had the cheesecake and although a super small portion, enough just to  pop the last button off our fat pants. Spanx need not apply here.   Great place. A+. Highly on my fatty does Vegas tour.

MpNabjQP0CrQrua7O_GlGQ.text: This place was Amazing! I have expectations from any place I go to in Vegas and Sage did not disappoint. My boyfriend and I started with the foie gras custard with brioche toast and we could have just had that. The meal only got better. I couldn't have been happier with my choice!
