Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2R_2kxZiZeVX-1F6GMjhKQ.text: The tartare is probably the best thing ever. I got the chartreuse drink. It was just ok. A lot of ice. But the group I was with enjoyed their drinks. Sazerac is very solid. The foie gras was more of a dessert dish, but was very impressive.  Service was professional, fast, and friendly. This was my second time there, can't wait to go back!

x5-d-NQV5xIAiN7kvjAuGw.text: Came with a group of 6 and was sat promptly at time that was scheduled. Had the seasonal tasting menu, the appatizer was mediocre roasted carrots will not be one of my future picks flavor was unique but not my cup of tea. The skirt steak was great as well as the accompanying mashed potatoes and mushrooms. Service was very underwhelming we literally waited 45 minutes for our check AFTER ASKING TWICE. Ambiance was nice they have a two man band which was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage menu

xATDqZUd9ZL0EjOrLLgvsw.text: Close your eyes children, it's about to go down  If this was my last meal on the face of this Earth, I would have died the only way I would like to and then gone straight to heaven to take a nap. Luckily, this was my last meal of the trip, and then I went to see Calvin Harris after at Hakkasan. So it's pretty much equivalent to going to heaven and taking a nap because I don't remember anything after.  Definitely sexy  It's the kind of restaurant you want to spend your dinners at in Vegas. Very fitting for a sexy night out, dark and welcoming space with warm colors and vibrant high-end materials. Not to mention the at tentative servers who make you feel like a boss. I literally left there telling people to give me their TPS reports. "Apparently you didn't put one of those new cover letters on the new TPS reports......" Who doesn't like feeling like a boss?   I wish I had an endless stomach.  For occasions like this, I want to eat their food forever. Try their tasting menu or off a la carte in this exact order: 1) Vancouver Island Oysters 2) Wagyu Beef Tartare 3) Grilled Spanish Octopus 4) Main Day Boat Scallops 5) 48 Hour Beef Belly 6) Meyer Lemon Cheesecake .............then tell the kids to close their eyes.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef tartare
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 48 hour beef belly
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. oysters

pwt8vnDqQnMLUAHqgy7aYQ.text: Located by registration and the neighboring crystals wing of the expansive Aria resort, this unassuming contemporary restaurant had me intrigued as soon as I stepped inside.   As we traversed through the dimly lit bar flanked with purple hued impressionist walled paintings that soared up to the high ceilings and into the main dining area, I couldn't help but be impressed by the sleek modern club-like feel of the space. It was the perfect mix of contemporary cool with traditional elegance. With chilled house music pulsating in the background, I did get an ultra lounge vibe from the restaurant, which was actually refreshing and relaxing. We also didn't feel crammed next to our neighboring diners, which made things feel much more intimate and private.  Our server was full of friendly banter and made every effort to make us feel welcome.    We all went with the Signature Tasting Menu.  The wait staff knew that we were heading out to a show afterwards so they made sure our dishes came out at a good pace.   We were started with a tuna tartare amuse bouche that was just the right mouthful of tang & punch of flavor to whet our appetites.  The first courses were all very good. From the fresh oysters to the beautifully prepared wagyu beef tartare to the exceptionally inventive foie gras brulee.  The second courses were inspiring and enjoyable, as well. The octopus was grilled to perfection and the dayboat scallops were easily the best I've ever had! These thick golden medallions were beautifully seared on the outside locking in a fluffy and buttery flesh that left me in complete awe bite after bite.  Our third courses were also winners in my book.  The wagyu sirloin was mouthwatering and each tender bite was blissful. The 48 hour braised beef was incredibly soft and you could tell it was cooked for awhile for all those rich, permeating flavors to develop.  Desserts were exquisite and what could be better than a surprise at the very end! A shot of cinnamon hot white chocolate. It was both warm comforting and festive. An excellent end to an amazing meal.   I can't say enough about my wonderful experience here. It's definitely one I'd gladly experience again and again.  Happy Eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-CU3yDZpu04wWf_UYvZVPw.text: We had dinner here. The chestnut soup was superb. Poached egg came with delicious bread. We ordered the famous scallops which I would give 4.5 stars out of 5. The last but not least, the beef short rib. This is so far THE best beef short rib we have ever had. It was cooked through and melted in mouth. 5 out of 5 for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

pHWkZrrH0_-RFcJsaGHIaQ.text: A top notch restaurant that was delicious from start to finish.  The people working there will literally give you the shirt off their back!  My wife was freezing and our excellent server offered the manager's cardigan to wear during dinner.  Who does that??  We went with Chef McClain's Signature Menu for $89.  No wine pairings because I am usually too buzzed at the end to appreciate the flavors.  I started with the "Wagyu Beef Tartare" with crushed caper aioli, slow poached egg and dark chocolate.  Chocolate and beef isn't a combo I am usually down with but it was a fun twist that totally worked.  I literally could've had this as my whole meal.  The buttered and grilled sourdough bread complemented it perfectly.  My wife got the "Foie Gras Brulee" which was wow, wow, wow.  It was such a creative dish and a wild mix of flavors upon first taste but it just got better and better after each bite.  It's ok to lick the dish, right?  This could have been a dessert and I wondered if the chef ever considered that.    I got the "Australian Wagyu Sirloin" for my main entree.  It was as tender as expected but I was ready to swap after having a bit of the 48 hour beef belly.  That was treeeeemendous and what I would go with had I done it all over again.    "Gianuja Pave" was my choice for dessert.  It's not often I get to try olive oil ice cream with basil jam.  That was a really excellent ending to the meal and kept up with the creativity of the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu beef tartare
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras brûlée! Good god!
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine dayboat scallop

AFzYXnpJMj2q77-g6EOolg.text: This place is a solid 4.  Maybe with a lower price I could go 5, but definitely a four.    My wife got the vegan tasting menu.  I don't quite understand why they don't advertise this more.  Sadly I don't remember too much about it, but it did have a really good variety of fresh veggies with some creative sauces and applications.  Great use of some unique meaty mushrooms to make up for the absence of meat.    I started with the foie Gras.  I don't know if I just don't like it or I just didn't like this one.  The brioche was almost too salty as it was hard for my palate to distinguish the flavors. I don't think I would order again, probably the lowlight of the meal.   I go the scallops.  Oh my goodness.  Probably one of the best bites I've ever had.  I would order a whole bowl of that and eat it every day.  Sweet, savory, rich, fresh. Just all the wonderfulness of the beef, scallops and mushrooms.    For the entree I got the beef belly.  Great textures and flavors of fat and meat.  My only complaint was that the starch it was on was really gummy and a little unpleasant.  The portion was very small, but I guess that's what I paid for.    The coconut basil foam dessert was a treat.  Cool play of textures and temperatures in the foam that hardened on the ice.  very fresh end to a wonderful meal.   If every item had lived up to the scallops I would give it a five, but if you are going to charge that much, you definitely will be help to a higher standard.   The service was very professional and accommodating.  No complaints there.

A75MdDNVTs0MIFx0JLousA.text: Came here back in October for my husband's surprise birthday trip to Vegas. We stayed at Aria Sky suites so this was a restaurant he wanted to try since the last time we were in Vegas. We are definitely glad we came to sample their menu.  First of all, the restaurant is tastefully decorated...it's trendy but has an old world charm feeling to it. Maybe it's the absinthe station I saw walking in....but I was absolutely obsessed with trying it out once I saw it. But first, I want to first speak on the impeccable service that we received. I hate that I forgot his name but he was so knowledgeable about the menu and made great suggestions on drinks. He even explained everything I needed to know about trying out absinthe for the first time. Which I will get to later :) I had the cotton candy cocktail and omg it is so good! I love food and drinks that "wow" me. So of course when he brings me a drink with a cup and nothing but cotton candy in it, I was instantly trying to figure it out. He pour liquor over it, and I could see the cotton candy melting into the drink. I knew instantly this was going to be a good one!!!! I forgot what my hubby ordered, but it was equally impressive. Their drink menu is awesome. I really wanted to try several, but I am a light weight and I really wanted to try to save some room for the absinthe. When it came down to ordering the absinthe, our server gave us a little history and how the menu works. If you see it you would know what I mean, it's a little confusing to read. But he gave me suggestions, so I ordered the original and the St. Germaine. Honestly, even though they are suppose to taste different, It was still not my cup of tea---the taste just isn't for me. If you like star anise favor then this is for you. But I am glad we tried it out anyway. I am always down to try anything once! Even if it's poison! haha Now to the food...you will see beautiful pictures of their signature scallop dish all around Aria. My mouth would water every time I saw it, so it was so brainer what I was going to order. Guess the advertisement worked because my husband ordered the same too lol. That  dish is absolutely delicious, perfect flavor combination with the soft tender oxtails. Everything cooked to perfection.  A must try. Oh, I also ordered the foie gras creme brulee since I just love foie gras....it is definitely different but it is quite rich for one person. So even though it's small serving I would suggest sharing it with someone, unless you just LOVE the fattiness of it all to yourself. But it is different, and I am so glad I ordered it. So hard to explain it... There is just so many different textures and flavors going on at the same time! They also send you different types of "shooters" in between courses to clear your palette. For example, one I remember was a fruity one (I think it was Mango?) but it was very refreshing. And I love that because it really resets your palette. I noticed this trend taking place in more luxury dining establishments now and I like it.  It was definitely a great evening. Give this place a try if you are in Vegas next time.

i3xBZS0b7CnhjDarnqJY0w.text: Came here last weekend with my boyfriend.  It was veryyy classy inside, the place has a very nice and open layout, nice and dim inside.  I ordered a cucumber cocktail (SO DELICIOUS) and he got a beer.  We ordered the grilled octopus appetizer to start, and it was soooo tender (definitely order if you're into octopus).  We both ended up getting the salmon entree.  Salmon was cooked so well, with such crispy skin.  We obviously made the mistake of getting the same entree and not trying two different ones.  We also ordered the lemon thyme foam with pomegranate sorbet dessert with this foam that was absolutely amazingggg. We got this because we were looking for something kind of tart to end our dinner with, and it did the trick.  Service was amazing- very attentive and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled octopus
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon entree

jIk_bgXWpsKA1JtwXzTYBw.text: Started with the wagyu tartare and the octopus, which were both delicious. I especially love the sauce on the octopus. I then ended with the skirt steak and our server was very attentive til the end. The restaurant is very chic and romantic with deep house lounge music which reminds me of some NYC restaurants. I have no complaints so I will be returning when I come back to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skirt Steak

6yv1wPYfcEgrgjspcmWOPw.text: So I saw the foie gras (FG) creme brulee on a list of "must try' FG dishes in Vegas and being the FG-deprived CA girl that I am I simply had to try it. ;-)   This turned out to be an amazing deal of a meal! My girlfriends and I chose to do the Signature tasting menu which was more than enough food, as I actually couldn't even finish all my food. I still can't believe it was only $89 -- seemed super reasonable for the quality of food and caliber of service/ambiance.   Our server started out a little stuffy but eventually warmed up and turned out be very friendly in the end. Make sure you order a cocktail here. They have a great variety of fun and unique drinks. We tried several all of which the names escape me but we really enjoyed them all.   Standout dishes included the the foie gras creme brulee (of course!) -- it really was as delicious and decadent as everyone raves.  I also really enjoyed the Maine dayboat scallops and and the wagyu skirt steak -- upcharge on this one but worth it as it was very tender and flavorful. My friend also really enjoyed her 48hour beef belly.   The Pave dessert here also wowed me, and I'm not one to be wowed by dessert.  It has to be one fo the best I've ever had at a fine dining restuarant and the olive oil ice cream was UNBELIEVABLE. I loved every bite of it!   I'd come back here in a heartbeat and hope they don't become wise to the fact that they're one of the best deals in Vegas IMHO! ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine diver scallops w oxtail
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras creme brûlée...delicious!

LtoYoA4Oq1QNitCaOy3umg.text: Phenomenal service and food.  Got the Paillard champagne with Foie Gras brulee for a quick after work snack.  I think this is what I would have as my last meal if someone told me I had to die tomorrow.

meW904xpZTe1e827o3eeRQ.text: Sage is a good restaurant but by no means one of the top experiences available in Las Vegas. The food is good, the service was not quite as good as the food. That being said, you will not have anything that is truly bad. The scallop entree is a very good dish.

4chMV9FDnBdjU3N8dvoBPQ.text: Atmosphere: dark, intimate, fine-dining. Employees seem knowledgeable and willing to find answers to any diner's question.   The menu is set up as a tasting menu, where prices vary on the number of courses selected from each of 4 sections. This is could be nice, except the bill racks up quickly. According to my husband, "don't go here if you're hungry." The portions are small for US standards, but I would say they are normal human portions. An amuse bouche is offered, which is nice. They have a very small vegan menu and a few more vegetarian options. They will also accommodate gluten-free diners.  Presentation is also highly prized and well-done- think food tweezers and pouring sauces out of little containers table-side b  The chestnut soup was a unique flavor- earthy, oniony, toasty. The poached egg was interesting- almost like an egg soup. The the venison was well-cooked and standard.   The outliers- hazelnut espresso mousse topped with a crumble and caramelized persimmon slices. It was fabulous, a textural wonderland, bursting with flavor, and a balance of sweet and salty- Just perfect. The other- the amazingly attentive and helpful busboy. Nevertheless, I would have expected a little more for the price.

yWlsUEOpAONsqsgFoneSWw.text: Located in the Aria hotel this place is a must see. A great selection of high end spirits in a cozy environment. Small plate of food at the bar with drinks are a great place to start before your show

coirYGCHI4kz5DO3_ynA5A.text: I love this place! If I'm at the bar eating or being seated down for a nice dinner this place is always 5 at all times. The staff is very polite and well mannered, and what's great about this place is they have my favorite wine Bigaro which I love! And I always recommend this restaurant to my friends and colleagues. Try the scallops it's absolutely to die for! Sage is my place to goto for drinks and amazing food!   Best,  K.Kaviar

C4tpbbFzXlAy-yHErfwfOQ.text: Maybe this was a case of Yelp hyping up a place and such great expectations that led to a meh kind of night for me.   I had friends in town visiting and decided to do something special for one of their birthdays and made reservations at Sage after reading all of the amazing things about McClain's restaurant.   Upon arrival, we were greeted and brought into the restaurant which I have to say is gorgeous. The decor and tones of purple make it very sensual and elegant. Loved the ambiance going on!  Bread basket was okay. The breads were a little too hard and it hurt a little having to bite down so hard on them. I did enjoy the amuse bouche very much although I can't recall what it was. I had ordered the Wagyu Short Rib and shared the Beef Tartare app. Honestly, the Beef Tartare was the only reason I didn't give Sage a 1 star unfortunately. The tartare was paired very well with the capers, mustard and egg on top. It all worked very well!  I can't say the same about my short rib. It was very meh and I am very sad to have to report that. It was accompanied with white asparagus and roasted turnips. The short rib is braised 36 hour but it did not fall apart/feel like it was and was very tough to cut. It is always a shame to see the appetizer outshine the entree in my eyes, especially at a place like this. My friends each had the scallops and pork loin. FWIW, my friend enjoyed her scallops very much. And the pork loin was also meh in his opinion. :(  The icing on the cake was that I let the waitress know ahead of time that it was a friends birthday at the table and did not go out of her way to prepare anything special for him and simply brought us the check at the end of the night. I know it's not a written rule, but not even a cursory dessert for the price that I'm paying for the meal and kind of restaurant this is?! No thank you!  Overall, thoroughly disappointed but maybe I had too high of an expectation for Sage. Would I return to give it a second chance? After all of the glowing reviews, it's still a iffy maybe.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farm Whey Pork Loin
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amuse Bouche
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu Short Rib

ikwDNDMFjPMLP0LW97FGmg.text: If you're a foodie or in any way yearning for a unique experience this is your stop. Ended up eating at the bar, got fantastic service with a full menu. I was told the lamb pappardelle was s great new addition but wanted to try the sweetbreads and (was told by everyone) must try the foie gras creme brulee.   The sweetbreads were amazingly tender and succulent, great texture with an amazing sauce throughout. Took most of my self control not to drink it. The foie gras might be one of the most unique things I've ever eaten; be warned your brain and palate might have the best nervous breakdown ever. The crazy combination of sweet shell, fruit, richness and salt of the foie gras was absolutely amazing. Combined with a wonderful Pinot noir and the foodie in me was in heaven.

r5T2FF7iPwctylGLd85W7A.text: This restaurant has the best scallop in the Vegas. My husband loves scallop and has tried scallop dishes from many different places. This one is definitely top 3!   I recommend grilled peach salad with the scallop. We also had pea soup and short rip. I would say just have the salad and scallop. I don't mean that the soup and short rip are not good, but just the salad and the scallop are so good and much better than the other two. Even if you don't like scallop, this place is worth a try.   The other important thing is service. The service is top notch! If the scallop is top 3, the service is THE BEST! Our server was very knowledgeable and attentive. Everything he recommended was absolutely amazing. He explained everything so well like stories behind each dish, ingredient, etc. He made sure that we enjoy the food and like the restaurant. I can say, in addition to the food, he is the one that makes us want to go back to sage. I hope restaurant manager will see this review and appreciate our server's hard effort. I think his name is Jher V or something (don't remember exactly, shame on me...). He was an asian guy serving us last night (9/24) from 6-7:15pm. We decided to give him about 50% tip because he deserved it.

dhkN-hALvGT6sgOXuDCUfg.text: So I came here about a year ago and did just the absinthe tasting and I came back to do it again and maybe... MAYBE get one or two food items. John, my server suggested the Oysters and the beef tartare but once I saw the tasting menu I decided I had to go with it.  1. Lightly Smoked Ora King Salmon with Haricot Vert, Kumquat, Golden Ostera Caviar. -- I love raw salmon and this dish was no exception. The crumbled baguette gives an amazing sandy texture. The caviar was just... salty. The green beans give an amazing crunch that I really enjoyed. The dish was very citrusy but not exactly kumquat. It was more sweet than tart, not sure how they managed that with the kumquat.  The flavor and textures were very reminiscent of sweet cream / creamy buttery flavor? I realized the dish had masago in it too. Super... amazing and very refreshing dish. I guessed that the crumbled baguette was actually some kind of lemon shortbread cookies and I was right! I think there were some nuts in it? made it taste like carne asada or something. Pairing with remy Martin is amazing. Amazing Amazing dish.  2. Seared Foie gras with Green Apple, Yuzu, Dashi.  Incredibly savory and fatty. Dashi foam. Very nice balance of fruity and fatty. Amazing apple flavor. Don't taste the yuzu. Was extremely savory and bacony flavor. Enjoyed this immensely. I believe it was the first time I've had an actual, hefty, chunk of foie by itself.   2.5 I asked the server to have the chef throw this in somewhere. Wagyu Beef Tartare with crushed caper aioli, slow poached egg, and crispy chocolate.  This was served with the most deliciously toasted bread. There was some pickled radish that tasted appley. The tartare was cold and had a silky texture. I'm guessing the caper aioli gave it a slight tart / vinegary flavor to the dish. I loved the crunchyness of the toasted bread. There was more than enough. Again, a very nice and refreshing dish. The radish is very tart and maybe was marinated in apple cider vinegar. The egg yolk was basically dried / cooked to a hardened but not hard boiled texture. It wasn't runny and I wonder if it was over cooked. I think that the chocolate chip should have been served separately. Everything over powered it but it tasted so good dark and strong roasted flavors but quickly disappeared I wish there was more of this. It was probably the most unique part of the dish but it's a shame it didn't really pair well. Ultimately, I don't think I'm a fan of beef tartare though this was done well.   3. "Maine Day-Boat Scallops with 'chowder' sauce / bacon / coffee and green chartreuse. The scallops were seared on the outside and soft in the center. The dish was extremely rich and baconey. It also had baby leeks. It tasted like sweet cream and was really buttery. Almost like clam chowder re-imagined. The scalops were a bit sandy but eh. Very unique dish but... it basically tasted like clam chowder. I didn't get the coffee flavor. Not sure if I tasted the Chartreuse either.   4. Japanese F1 Wagyu. with Ancho Romesco, asian pear, lacinato kayle, and pumpkin seeds. Legit or marketing gimmick? Not sure. Supposedly you get F1 when you cross breed wagyu and angus cows. The flavor was very bacony. Not my favorite though it had a very nice, juicy, and tender texture. Soft steamed pears are honestly so nice. Got a slight tartness somehow and the savoryness of pine nuts. Kale chips. There were pearls of potatoes as well so I enjoyed playing a game called potatoes or pears with myself. I later learned that the pine nut flavor came from the Ancho Romesco which is a pureee of hazelnuts, pine nuts, and bell peppers. The kale eventually softened and took on a texture akin to collard greens.  I could honestly barely finish this. The tasting menu probably would have sufficed and I could have done without the tartare.   5. Chocolate pot de creme with white chocolate cream, Guinness chocolate cake, and oreo crumbles. Dish was ok. It just tasted like a chocolate pudding with thick, dense chocolate cake. I din't enjoy it too much.  6. Grand Finalle, Got a comped Absinthe experience from MGM's rewards. Chose the Butterfly this time. I went with the traditional experience this time and they lit a sugar cube on fire and let ice water slowly drip down into the glass. I'm not sure if the pour was too light or if they added too much water but it ended up tasting a bit faint. There was a distinct aspartame flavor that I did not enjoy. Possibly, absinthe just isn't my thing.  Honestly if you're thinking about doing the tasting menu, I'd say go for it. For $130 I think it's a steal. I greatly enjoyed the salmon tartare and the foie gras. The service was excellent but typical for fancy dining. My server John and the busser Jacob were both extremely helpful in repeating every single ingredient and description of what I was eating. Only complaint is that the meal was extremely heavy and much of it tasted like bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butterfly, traditional serving method.
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate pot de creme, tasting menu
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. F1 Wagyu, tasting menu

eQ-LU58zoPKqmXRv1deJ5A.text: Excellent service. Excellent food. Great atmosphere. The venue is tucked away through a hall from the lobby keeping it intimate and exclusive. Keep an eye out for the two absinthe stations. They are quite elaborate if your are adventurous. I thought it would be too loud but it was just enough.  I normally don't like fancy food but this place even pleased me. The prices are high but not extreme. The food was plentiful too. I didn't feel like I paying a fortune for almost no food.  Tip: they will split the salads in half to keep the price down so you can share them between two people. They will offer you bread but make sure to try them all. Don't settle for just one!

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming baked alaska
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fois Gras candy bar
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot de creme

6a_LDcsh97vD5fJ9ySG7LA.text: While in Vegas, was looking for a dinner spot last minute. Luckily Sage had availability. Reading the reviews on yelp and Vegas.com. An upscale fine dining experience with seafood and meat options located in the Aria hotel. Upon entering you pass several large glass cases of wine . Beautiful display. Darkly lit, great chic and upscale ambiance perfect for a date night. Our waiter was exceptional, asking if there are any dietary restrictions and offering extensions. We were a party of 4 and ordered filets and short ribs amongst us. I also had the gem salad which includes romaine and smoked trout. Everything was outstanding. The menu was short but that tells me everything is fresh. The presentation was unbelievable. They really take pride in astetics. If you're willing to splurge and eat at a high end restaurant, this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1rClD0ncS0MiyfF0Ac154Q.text: I came here after a Cirque du Soleil show and the ambience and food were really an amazing finishing touch to the night. The bar lights up beautifully as you enter the dining area toward your seats and the music completes the whole young, but discerning vibe. I had the Little Gem salad that thankfully was both hefty and delicious. The  Vancouver Island Kushi Oysters were equally tasty as was the tuna tartar. One drawback I'd like to note is that the kitchen was out Of prime rib. It's nice to tell guests ahead of time of any dishes that might be out of before they order. Seeing as it was late on a Friday night, however, one can understand. Last but certainly not least was a foie gras candy bar dessert that words just cannot do it justice. I'll definitely be back here with friends from out of town. The service and food are worth writing home about!

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guest
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor view
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

r0MBspNb7KcquIrn8s0uWg.text: Me and my wife came here for a celebratory anniversary dinner, we love to treat ourselves to fancy dinners with amazing food and drinks! I'm particularly fond of restaurants that focus on farm to table, Sage was high end dining at its finest with a relaxed atmosphere and a menu focused on fresh seasonal ingredients.  I was set on getting the 5 course tasting menu which started with a king salmon appetizer with caviar that was just bursting with flavor, it was absolutely amazing, every bite was an explosion of flavor and textures that left a giant smile on my face! 2nd course was the foie gras dish... This might've been the best foie gras dish I've ever had...Wow wow wow! HEAVEN! 3rd course was the scallops, another home run! All 3  courses I paired with the Westmalle triple ale, all worked wonderfully in their own ways, 4th course was the Japanese Waygu steak which I paired with the dark roasty bready doppelbock the celebrator, from Ayinger brewery, another excellent match! Final course was a yummy chocolate pot de Creme with Guinness cake, a great finish to a memorable meal.  The service was friendly and frequent, all expectations were matched and then some. I have to also compliment this place on their excellent beer selection, I'm a huge beer nerd and the opportunity to drink very respected and rare beers in Vegas was a very very nice surprise!

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Westmalle Trappist ale
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The celebrator doppelbock ale
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate pot de Creme with Guinness cake

8CCkXk1PK_t6QjlKIP1o3g.text: Great atmosphere and service.  I would recommend the ravioli and scallops. The wine/spirit list is very extensive.

LfYL_jENwnXi63tLIR9LOA.text: Everything about this place is top notch. From the staff to the food to the ambiance.   Reservation to dining - we ran late and they easily and graciously pushed our reservation back. They are all very polite and polished as well. Our waiter was professional, personable and attentive. He came back just enough to be courteous but not annoying, I think that balance is an art. He had stories and explanations for all the dishes we asked, and it was quite a lot. It seems this isn't a place that gives the food to the staff for free or a great discount, as he hadn't tried many of the dishes but still knew them like the back of his hand. To me this means that the food is very quality, rare and not just food they charge us a lot for and eat for free in the back.   Food:  Roasted Veal Sweetbreads - this was a very interesting dish, and I'd never had it. I discovered that sweetbreads is a culinary name for the thymus or pancreas. The flavor was interesting and the textures were nice. It was a unique offering and I'm glad we did enjoy it.  Delicata Squash Salad -  nice flavors, light and tasty. The pear was exceptional, and the pairings were perfect. The dressing was light enough to make it easy to eat without an overpowering flavor.  Iberico "SECRETO" Pork absolutely my favorite dish. It's a portion of the pig in the shoulder so it was a good texture. The meat was seared to give it a crispness that I thoroughly enjoyed. Sauce and flavors were just so incredibly good. Order this dish!  Wagyu Flat Iron Steak - Probably around 6-8 ounces, and more than my partner could eat because of the apps. Great flavor and cooked to perfection. You know you're in a good spot when they don't ask you how you want it cooked because they know how to cook this dish to perfection.   When I return I'll bring a bigger appetite and try the tasting menu, my mouth was watering just thinking about it.   Ambiance was a purple glow and it was quiet and intimate, which I appreciated. There was a large group off to the side so they weren't disrupting everyone else which seemed to be on dates.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Purple glow in the restaurant and wagyu beef!
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. IBERICO &#34;SECRETO&#34; PORK, great decor.
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. IBERICO &#34;SECRETO&#34; PORK

4UrSrJaoeuAW18dM3fwMdA.text: Fine dining with huge portions, delicately executed, and great service!  We came in for dinner and ordered a tasting menu and some a la carte dishes.   Recommended dishes: - Foie gras brulee - Short ribs - Bay scallops  All hot dishes came with hot plates. And the meat dishes came with sides that took away grease.   Pre-meal bread were hot and home baked.   Servers were friendly and professional, refilled our water very frequently, and we didn't have to wait extensively long waits for any course.   The whole experience was no less than a michelin-star experience and definitely was beyond my expectation.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicata squash salad
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb parpadelle
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bay scallops

U2yl4jIDe0sE6ehWjkoCqg.text: Wow we loved our experience here! Food was delicious, host and waiters were so nice and great ambiance! I had the Alaskan halibut and the scallops with oxtail...omg the scallops were perfection and the halibut was really nice...I was blown away by how flavorful the eggplant and red pepper emulsion were, those flavors really shined through! Had an old fashioned and cucumber cocktail. Lastly had the parfait but I didn't realize it would be enveloped in marshmallow substance and lit on fire!

M5QCk9UeXK6ugTGjrcO7Ew.text: The group wanted to do a tasting, but with without choices or substitutions on the tasting menu, we decided to each create our own by ordering three dishes each. Big mistake - that was way too much food! The portions for the mains are quite large and can be shared between at least two people.   So if you are like us and like to taste a bunch of items, I would suggest ordering a salad and an appetizer each, and ordering one main for every two people. Then you may still have room for dessert.   The food was excellent! The foie gras was given the compliment of "this is the best foie gras I've ever eaten" from my husband who eats foie gras every chance he gets. And the poached egg - I seriously never knew an egg could taste so good! The Iberico Pork and the Wagyu were also incredible. The halibut was good, but not as good as the other mains.   Really enjoyable dinner so if you're looking for a good place to eat in Vegas this is a good place to stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poached Egg w/ Truffle
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine Day Boat Scallops
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu NY Strip Steak

Tpm1JKBfhsxgeL4w9rRWaQ.text: I will admit to you that the only reason we "ended up" here at Sage, was because of a MyVegas reward.  We were staying next door at Vdara, celebrating our 10th anniversary (and we love absinthe) so the absinthe experience here seemed like a logical reward to choose.  We originally intended to just pop in for that, and dessert, but upon closer inspection of reviews and menus, decided to just make a reservation for our whole anniversary dinner.  This was the best decision we could have possibly made.  From the moment we were greeted and escorted in by the hostess, we were treated like absolute royalty.  We were there on a Monday evening just after opening, so there weren't many other tables yet.  I think this created a quiet, intimate and romantic experience that you wouldn't necessarily get on a Friday night.  It felt very exclusive this way, each new staff member becoming a new friend, calling us Mr and Mrs _, etc.  Just beautiful.  The purple and lime and candlelight originally worried me when I saw photos here on yelp, if I'm continuing to be honest.  I wanted some really exquisite anniversary ambience and I wasn't sure this was it.  But I tell you what - it is has a cooling effect coming off the strip, if that makes sense.  It's like a glowing cave - a modern and fun, but still romantic and elegant hue.  I actually loved the whole vibe.  The sommelier listened intuitively to our preferences, then described and poured us the most perfect wines and champagne.  The list is epic.  Do explore it.  The server, the bread/water guy, the manager... all steered us in the right directions for our meal.  We had the Himachi Salad, the Little Gem Salad (a delicious and unique twist on caesar flavors), the Wagyu tartare (O.M.G. I don't even have to tell you it was like buttah), and the Scallops, which scared me at first because a) putting salted caramel sauce on them sounds completely counterintuitive and gross really and b) I never enjoy scallops.  I have never had them not taste like rubber.  WELL.  GUESS what is now one of my favorite dinners, ever in history?  Those scallops with their delicious counterintuitive gravy-sauce!  Woo! They ruined me.  I will probably just go back to never eating a scallop again because no one will do it like Sage.  We finished with the pot d'creme.  Luscious.    I must say, I really appreciate that they simply let us be lovebirds and share all of our plates between us instead of making us feel like we needed separate plates to be proper, or that we were somehow cheap for not getting individual entrees, etc.  Some establishments (esp in Vegas!) would charge you for such requests.  But the Absinthe Experience!  The cart and presentation, the magical fountain, it all sets the tone.  At least one of you HAS to get it served fire and ice style, because pouring a glass full of fire by your table is so Vegas.  And you get to inhale the buzzy fumes.  We did two varieties, served two different ways, and it was so interesting to compare and share them.  Absinthe is just fun period, but Sage has somehow made it entertaining to serve as well.  It was truly a one of a kind celebration.  We cannot wait to return one day.  Thank you to the entire staff, and especially the manager, for making this an unforgettable night for us both.

SsRP4dQqoP2Ef6N9Uy8GYw.text: Restaurant is visually stunning, Clean, posh and nice to look at. The Absinthe bar was very cool looking. Service was average.   Maybe I just ordered bad items but I didn't care for the scallops or anything we ate. I thought it was over priced for average food. I have high expectations when I am spending $$$$ on food that it has to be perfect.   I left disappointed because everyone seems to love it and I usually love fancy restaurants. Not sure I would go again with all the options in Vegas.

Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Visually stunning

6Ll5Bdu8h2WxiNYewSjuVg.text: Dined at Sage in the Aria on a Monday evening in April around 8pm. Pretty crowded with groups that looked like they were traveling on business. There's a front area to the restaurant with a large bar and then a large back room with tables.   The menu would probably be classified as upscale American. My group split a burrata/greens salad and steak tartare to start. For my entree, I got the duck and it was cooked perfectly. Huge wine list which had some really impressive bottles. Enjoyed both apps and my entree a lot. No complaints, but definitely a little pricey!

Xwg388yirFdi6_kyn5D04Q.text: We came here on a Friday night, we got our table right ways and our server is very friendly and patient to introduce the dishes to us. They have different style food on their menu, steak, seafood, salad, soup...but all the dishes are in creativity style We tried their tasty menu, very good potion, you will have 2 small plates, one entree, one desert, all the dishes are in very good potion and very special and tasty, highly recommended  And we also tried Poached egg Sunchoke Soup Scallops : this one is my favorite, scallops are cooked with some very flavored source, so yummy yummy  Overall a wonderful dinning experience and I will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M-bUSxYtbE3zKjUoa6Nj6w.text: Sage was such an amazing experience that I'm mad I didn't visit this gorgeous restaurant sooner! When I walked in, I was seriously captivated by how sexy the room looks from floor to ceiling. The staff was very courteous when checking us in and greeting us through the dining room.   Aaron took wonderful care of us at the bar, and made sure my friend's birthday experience was nothing short of perfection. Between three of us we ordered two tasting menus, the foie gras, and the scallops which came highly recommended. If you come to Vegas, you have to stop here just for the foie alone.   I'm usually not a wine pairing kind of girl because I prefer cocktails, but this pairing for the tasting menu was spot on and Christine & her team of Sommes definitely know what they're doing!    Dessert from the tasting menu was a chocolate pot de creme of sorts and I wish I could have taken it to go/finished it if I wasn't so full.   I cannot wait to bring my family here for future celebrations and nights out!!

eKXRYpmNQexoV3_b-k0usg.text: We had a friend come in to vegas for the first time and wanted to try something with good selection on the strip. Since my friend was friends with one of the chefs at Sage inside the Aria we decided to come and enjoy the delicacies. The appetizers were a world in itself. We ordered about every single one and almost didn't have room for our entrees! The marine day scallops was amazing with the right amount of dairy and pieces of bacon that complemented the perfect succulent scallops. The ravioli was truly amazing and filling as well that had nice aged cheese and ground beef that went hand in hand. The foie gras toasted and fried roll was amazing with the right amount of sweetness and softness of the bread. First time I had medium rare pork that actually tasted like steak and was very juicy and went very well with the kale! I recommend this place and hope this business last many more years to come!

photos.caption: Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras Candy Bar
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sage - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli. Amazing

zG3dor3MK2YrOAjWwH-AsA.text: Came here Saturday night. The food was all cooked well. The steak tartare a bit too eggy for me. And the pork loin not my fav dish won't order that again. The ravioli everyone rants about tasted old or as if they had been left out to harden then poured over hot sauce. However service isn't too on point. Had to always search for my waiter. Just too slow and the place had only 10 tables and lots of workers.

KmQU5skLB0K3dsnLa4E4NA.text: Sage. Upscale. Expensive. Foodgasm.  My first time here even though I stayed at Aria so many times.  My best birthday experience in Las Vegas.   Everything is great and fancy here from decor to nice utensils and plates. Amazing, mysterious and very romantic ambience.   Fusion of American and mediterranean cuisine.   Oysters 5/5 (extra fresh and tasty) Wagyu beef tartare 5/5 (great fusion with salty chocolate, savory sauce, quail egg) Scallops 5/5 (OUTSTANDING!!! sauce, broccoli, mushrooms everything is balanced) Couldn't ask for better Halibut 5/5 (so tender and crispy) Complimentary dessert 5/5  Basil ice cream 5/5 speechless  Couldn't ask for better birthday experience. Reasonable price for quality of food you get. They were really nice and they took care of us on my birthday. Love it. 5/5
